## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with [x] -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have run the full test suite (`npm test`)
- [ ] I have tested the changes in multiple browsers (if applicable)

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated the README.md if needed
- [ ] I have updated TypeScript types/interfaces if needed
- [ ] I have added/updated Gherkin feature files if needed

### Commits

- [ ] My commits are signed off (using `git commit -s` or web UI signoff)
- [ ] My commit messages follow the project's commit message format
- [ ] I have rebased my branch on the latest main (if requested)

### Dependencies

- [ ] I have not added new dependencies unless absolutely necessary
- [ ] If dependencies were added, I have explained why in this PR description
- [ ] I have run `npm install` and verified no dependency conflicts

## CI Status

<!-- All CI checks must pass before merging -->

- [ ] All automated tests are passing
- [ ] CodeQL security scan is passing (if applicable)
- [ ] No merge conflicts with main branch

## Additional Notes

<!-- Add any additional information, concerns, or questions for reviewers -->

## For Reviewers

<!-- Guidelines for reviewers -->

When reviewing this PR, please check:

- [ ] Code quality and adherence to project patterns
- [ ] Test coverage is adequate
- [ ] Documentation is clear and accurate
- [ ] No security vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] Changes are scoped appropriately (not too large)
- [ ] Breaking changes are justified and well-documented

---

**Note**: All commits must be signed off to indicate agreement with the Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO). If you haven't signed your commits, you can do so using `git commit --amend -s` for the last commit, or use the signoff checkbox in the GitHub web UI when making changes.
